Award.AbstractNarration:
The CISE Research Infrastructure program drives discovery and learning in the computing disciplines by supporting the creation and enhancement of world-class computing research infrastructure. In 2014 NSF launched Phase I of the NSFCloud Mid-scale Research Infrastructure program to enable the academic research community to develop and experiment with novel cloud computing architectures and address emerging research challenges. Two distinct computing cloud infrastructure projects -- Chameleon and CloudLab -- were initiated.

The original NSF Cloud solicitation (NSF 13-602) anticipated two phases of the NSFCloud program, and recommended an external evaluation of the projects near the completion of Phase I. The objective of this proposed activity is to undertake that evaluation based on the goals of the NSFCloud program, as well as specific metrics outlined in each original NSFCloud proposal. This evaluation considers four main areas of focus: outreach and community, nature of the platform research, technical details of each project,
and efforts/approaches towards sustaining each project. Upon completion of the evaluation a written report will detail findings and offer concrete recommendations for advancing each system under Phase II of the program.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The project funded an evaluation activity on the two active awards funded by the NSF Cloud (NSF 13-602) program -  Chameleon (CNS-1419141/Chicago-Keahey) and CloudLab (CNS-1419199/Utah-Ricci), each of which was funded in Phase 1 with approximately $10M and which were in their final year.  This evaluation was conducted in response to the following language in the original NSF Cloud solicitation: "Approximately one year prior to the end of each Phase I award, each funded infrastructure activity will be evaluated by an external committee based on the goals of the NSF Cloud program, as well as specific metrics outlined in the original proposal."

The NSF Cloud Evaluation Committee was conducted through regular communications between the Evaluation Committee, Chameleon and CloudLab teams and NSF, beginning with questionnaires to the two project teams covering four areas of focus: outreach / community building, the nature of the research being performed on the platform, technical details concerning each team's approach, and efforts and approaches to project sustainability. After further communications to solicit answers to questions that arose from review of the background information and materials, in-depth meetings were held with the respective teams. Outcomes of this committee were in the form of correspondence, with a final report, "Review of the NSF Cloud Projects (Krieger et. al.)," submitted to the two teams and to the NSF.

The activity incorporated research community feedback, strengthening the research infrastructures and guided future improvements to better support the broad research community using these platforms.  The feedback of this report had a strong impact on the Phase II proposals by the teams and both teams where successful in obtaining Phase II awards (abstracts linked below).

Award Abstract #1743358: Collaborative Research: Chameleon: A Large-Scale, Reconfigurable Experimental Environment for Cloud Research - https://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1743358

Award Abstract #1743363: CloudLab Phase II: Community Infrastructure To Expand the Frontiers of Cloud Computing Research - https://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1743363
